CatDescriptText: Rev. George A. Fitch, West End AME Zion Council, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 15, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think common-law marriage should be outlawed?" answer reads: "I definitely think so. And the reason why is that it is an enticement to immorality and it has a deteriorating effect on the sacred institution of matrimony.  I think that we should have the desire to promote and sustain that which is sacred and honorable."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Reverend George A. Fitch wearing suit jacket dark tie with fleur-de-lis pattern, and moustache, standing on sidewalk in front of two men, with buildings, automobiles, large sign, and hillside with trees in background
